title.narrative: OUTP 4.1: NUTRITION POLICY, COORD & MGT.

description.narrative: Output 4.1: Equity-focused national policies, legislation, strategies and plans adopted for scaling up of high-impact critical nutrition interventions., which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: Infants, young children and mothers have increased and equitable use of nutritional services and improved nutrition and care practices, with a focus on stunting.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND CHILD CARE

sector.narrative: Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
